unnormalised: Hey guys, ever feel like you're drowning in a sea of ID cards? Aadhaar, PAN, Voter ID, DL... It's a bit much, right? Especially when you're trying to get something important done, like opening a bank account or applying for a loan. Honestly, keeping track of them all can feel like a full-time job.
normalised: Hey guys, ever feel like you're drowning in a sea of I-D cards? A-A-D-H-A-A-R, P-A-N, Voter I-D, D-L... It's a bit much, right? Especially when you're trying to get something important done, like opening a bank account or applying for a loan. Honestly, keeping track of them all can feel like a full-time job.

unnormalised: Let’s talk about the Aadhaar card first. It’s that 12-digit unique number issued by UIDAI. You need it for basically everything these days, from getting a new phone connection to verifying your identity at the railway station. My Aadhaar no. is something like 1234-5678-9012 (not really, though!), and I swear, I have to memorize it at least 5 times a year thanks to forgetfulness.
normalised: Let’s talk about the A-A-D-H-A-A-R card first. It’s that twelve-digit unique number issued by U-I-D-A-I. You need it for basically everything these days, from getting a new phone connection to verifying your identity at the railway station. My A-A-D-H-A-A-R number is something like one two three four dash five six seven eight dash nine zero one two (not really, though!), and I swear, I have to memorize it at least five times a year thanks to forgetfulness.

unnormalised: Then there's the PAN card. This one's crucial for all things financial. If you are planning to invest some money or deal in large transactions, then you cannot do without it. Issued by the Income Tax Department, its alpha-numeric sequence, like ABCDE1234F, is super important when filing your taxes. Imagine forgetting to link your PAN with your Aadhaar before the deadline – total chaos!
normalised: Then there's the P-A-N card. This one's crucial for all things financial. If you are planning to invest some money or deal in large transactions, then you cannot do without it. Issued by the Income Tax Department, its alpha-numeric sequence, like A B C D E one two three four F, is super important when filing your taxes. Imagine forgetting to link your P-A-N with your A-A-D-H-A-A-R before the deadline – total chaos!

unnormalised: Of course, we can’t forget the Voter ID, the EPIC no. I guess, which is issued by the Election Commission of India. Crucial when you're exercising your democratic right. It's kind of a big deal and it has some numbers along with the letters, like XYZ12345678.
normalised: Of course, we can’t forget the Voter I-D, the E-P-I-C number I guess, which is issued by the Election Commission of India. Crucial when you're exercising your democratic right. It's kind of a big deal and it has some numbers along with the letters, like X Y Z one two three four five six seven eight.

unnormalised: And then there is the Driving License (DL). Remember those learner's permit days? Well, to officially and legally drive on Indian roads, you’ll need a DL, which has your name, photograph, and DL no. Like every other ID, the DL number format differs state-wise, but you are required to keep one.
normalised: And then there is the Driving License (D-L). Remember those learner's permit days? Well, to officially and legally drive on Indian roads, you’ll need a D-L, which has your name, photograph, and D-L number. Like every other I-D, the D-L number format differs state-wise, but you are required to keep one.

unnormalised: Trying to remember which document you need for what can feel like a task in itself. It's like the government’s playing a real-life puzzle game.

unnormalised: But hey, at least now you have this blog post to remind you. Keep those ID cards safe, folks! They’re more valuable than you think. And maybe, just maybe, someday we'll have a single, universal ID for everything. A guy can dream, right?
